name: hbnae
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s2, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))

body.origin:
|- wi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s2, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
-| wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s2, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s2, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
-| wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s2, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))

body.origin: |- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s2, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))

comment: All variables are effectively bound in a distinct variable specifier. A version with a distinct variable condition based on fewer axioms is ~ hbnaev . Lemma L19 in [Megill] p. 446 (p. 14 of the preprint). (Contributed by NM, 13-May-1993.)
